Job Title: Truck Mechanic B

Location: Mauldin, SC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Address: USA-SC-Mauldin-208 Bi-Lo Boulevard

Store Code: DC 05 Tran Maintenance (7239008)

ADUSA Transportation is the transportation company of Ahold Delhaize USA, providing transportation services to one of the largest grocery retail supply chains in the nation. ADUSA Transportation delivers fresh and nonperishable products to local brand stores and supports the sustainability of the supply chain by returning recyclable items to recycling centers for processing. Our team is supporting the supply chain network evolution to become a fully integrated self-distribution model of the future, serving leading omnichannel grocery brands – Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop & Shop. To learn more about our company and the other supply chain companies of Ahold Delhaize USA, visit www.adusasc.com.

Primary Purpose

As a Truck Mechanic, you will be responsible for all major repairs, which include engine, transmission, accident damage and rear end within the transportation truck shop. You will perform all maintenance tasks that ensure a functional and operational transportation fleet.

Duties And Responsibilities

Perform Truck Mechanic B requirements in addition to performing all major preventive maintenance, major component rebuilds, and read and interpret all shop material.Perform all repairs and maintenance on refrigeration equipment as needed.Repair major structural damage to trailer, refrigeration system, components-internal repair, engine-internal repair.Perform welding functions as neededPerform all functions of a Truck Mechanic C, which includes basic service line function (ex. Check tire air pressure, change lights).Perform minor tune-ups.Solve electrical problems, brake problems, compressor preventive maintenance (refrigeration system).Repair all tractors (except rebuilds), warehouse equipment, components-external, minor trailer, refrigeration system, and external engines.Strive to find more efficient ways to do the job and seek to reduce costs and improve labor productivity.Make recommendations for modifications to procedures or processes impacting work group or distribution center that will maximize efficiency, productivity, and reduce costs.Ensure compliance with company standards in the areas of accuracy, safety and productivity.

Qualifications

Commercial driver’s license and certified electrician’s (refrigeration) license required.High school diplomaFamiliarity/experience in a transportation mechanical environment

Physical Requirements

Ability to reach, bend, stoop and lift up to and including 70 lbs.Work in a warehouse environment with varying conditions (i.e. cool temperatures, concrete floors, powered industrial trucks)

Preferred Requirements

Possess good communication, verbal and written skillsAbility to use tools requiredAbility to analyze situations, identify problems and implement solutionsAbility to meet production standards set by the company

We are an organization that values diversity and encourages all qualified individuals to apply without regard to sex, race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship status, religion, age, marital status (including civil unions), military service, veteran status, pregnancy (including childbirth and related medical conditions), genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, legally recognized disability, domestic violence victim status or any other characteristic protected by law. Our organization is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities, including applicants. If you have a disability and require assistance in the application process, please email recruiting@adusasc.com
